snippet: Third-party ownership, the practice of selling shares of players in exchange for part of future transfer fees, is a large part of many clubs’ operations, but FIFA is banning the practice starting in May.
abstract: Third-party ownership in soccer, practice of selling shares of players in exchange for part of future transfer fees, is large part of many clubs’ operations; system, underway in winter transfer window, has been described as combination of stock trading and gambling; FIFA , says it is banning practice starting in May 2015.
lead_paragraph: Third-party ownership, the practice of selling shares of players in exchange for part of future transfer fees, is a large part of many clubs’ operations, but FIFA is banning the practice starting in May.

headline.seo: FIFA Will Ban Third-Party Ownership in May
headline.main: A Contentious Source of Income Is Set to Dry Up
headline.print_headline: A Contentious Source of Income Is Set to Dry Up
